DOC.brief_summary: The Cutaneous Heart Sounds Data Collection During CRT Optimization study is an acute, prospective, non-randomized multi-center feasibility clinical trial. The purpose of this clinical trial is to collect data to assist in the testing and finalization of a hemodynamic sensor-based cardiac resynchronization therapy (CRT) optimization scheme.
DOC.brief_title: Cutaneous Heart Sounds Data Collection During Cardiac Resynchronization Therapy (CRT) Optimization Study
DOC.criteria: Subject must have been implanted with a Medtronic market approved CRTD device (Concerto®, Concerto® II, Maximo® II, Consulta®, Protecta™, or Protecta™ XT) within two years Subject must be 18 years of age or older Subject or his/her legally authorized representative has signed and dated the study specific informed consent form ("Consent Form") Subject is willing and able to comply with protocol requirements Subject with atrial tachyarrhythmia or frequent atrial or ventricular ectopy Subject is post mitral or aortic valve repair or replacement Subject is participating in other research studies that many confound the results of this study Subject is pregnant or in fertile age without secure birth control Subject has dementia Subject is unwilling to comply with protocol requirements Subject has a device and lead system with fractured leads Subject cannot undergo an echocardiograph procedure, or is contraindicated to undergo such a procedure
